seaFoods.name: Salmon
seaFoods.description: Salmon is rich and flavorful, known for its vibrant color and high omega-3 content. It's perfect for grilling, baking, or pan-searing. Enjoy it as a main dish, in salads, or sushi.

seaFoods.name: Shrimp
seaFoods.description: Shrimp are juicy and tender with a slightly sweet flavor. They're versatile and can be used in pasta, stir-fries, salads, or simply grilled. Quick to cook and loved by many.

seaFoods.name: Lobster
seaFoods.description: Lobster is delicate and sweet, making it a luxurious seafood choice. Often enjoyed steamed or grilled, it's perfect for special occasions. Serve with butter or in a rich lobster roll.

seaFoods.name: Tuna
seaFoods.description: Tuna is firm and meaty, ideal for steaks or sashimi. Its mild flavor and dense texture make it suitable for grilling, searing, or eating raw in sushi and poke bowls.

seaFoods.name: Crab
seaFoods.description: Crab is sweet and succulent, perfect for various dishes like salads, soups, and crab cakes. Its delicate flavor is best enjoyed with minimal seasoning to let its natural taste shine.

seaFoods.name: Oysters
seaFoods.description: Oysters are briny and fresh, often enjoyed raw on the half shell or grilled. They're a delicacy known for their unique flavor, which varies depending on their origin.

seaFoods.name: Scallops
seaFoods.description: Scallops are sweet and tender, perfect for searing or baking. They have a delicate texture and mild flavor, making them a gourmet choice for elegant meals.

seaFoods.name: Clams
seaFoods.description: Clams are briny and chewy, excellent in chowders, pasta dishes, or steamed with garlic and butter. Their robust sea flavor adds depth to many seafood recipes.

seaFoods.name: Mussels
seaFoods.description: Mussels are mild and tender, often steamed and served in a flavorful broth. They're quick to prepare and perfect as an appetizer or main dish with crusty bread.

seaFoods.name: Octopus
seaFoods.description: Octopus is firm and flavorful, ideal for grilling or adding to salads. Its unique texture and rich taste make it a standout in Mediterranean and Asian cuisines.
